Partial Solver module

partial_solver.get_partial_solutions(outgoing_node_pairs_set, exclusion_list, outgoing_node_directions_dict, state_grid, part_stock, path_problem)

Tries to generate partial solutions with the given node pairs. Node pairs may be excluded if no solution to any other node is found. Node pairs in the same tuple are prevented from connecting.

Parameters

  • outgoing_node_pairs_set¶ (NodePairset) – Set of node pairs that represent the end points of a layout

  • exclusion_list¶ (list [set]) – List of node pairs that are excluded from connecting.

  • outgoing_node_directions_dict¶ (FittingDirections) – Dictionary containing the directions each node can be connected to.

  • state_grid¶ (StateGrid) – See StateGrid

  • part_stock¶ (PartStock) – See part_stock.

  • path_problem¶ (PathProblem) – See :class:’PathProblem’.

partial_solver.fuse_partial_solutions(partial_solutions, completed_layouts, initial_path_problem)

Fuses partial solutions and completed layouts into a complete solution from start to goal of the initial path problem. Only partially checks the validity of the complete solution. Partial solutions and completed layouts must therefore be compatible and equal to a valid assembly layout.

Parameters

  • partial_solutions¶ (list [Solution]) – A list of solutions that (presumably) form a complete solution.

  • completed_layouts¶ (BuildingInstructions) – Dictionary containing only layouts that are fully completed.

  • initial_path_problem¶ (PathProblem) – The original path problem.

Returns

Solution that is a fusion of all partial solutions.
